intro: Fumaria megalocarpa, commonly known as the giant celandine, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family, characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant produces large, elongated seed pods that can reach up to 10 centimeters in length, containing numerous small, flat seeds. Its leaves are palmately lobed and covered in fine hairs, while the stems are hairy and often branched. Fumaria megalocarpa is typically found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas.
